column2: ARKANSAS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. A red traffic sign means?
2. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 3. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.
column6: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.

column2: 4. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 5. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column6: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.
column8: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.

column2: 6. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
8. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 9. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: stop as quickly as you can.
column6: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column8: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.

column2: 10. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
11. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
12. The picture shows a _________ sign.
13. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
14. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 15. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 16. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column6: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column8: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 18. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column8: the driver you just passed signals you over.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
20. This sign means:
21. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column6: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column8: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column8: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 23. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: stay focused on the center line on the road.
column6: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.

column2: 24. Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
column6: passing is permitted on the left.
column8: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
